Expected Behaviour:
Volume must be in Busy state.
After timeout volume must go into down state & I/O states can be ssen on initiator node.
Pod should  in running state and IO should continue even if volume is in down state
After deleting pods we can force detach/delete volumes. normal delete should fail
Notes / Detailed Description:
8pods running on appserv90 (initiator) attached to 8 volumes created on appserv91(target)
1) All the volumes went into Down(Degraded) while the pods stayed in running state.
2) The cluster got into NoFaultTolerance state
3) The IOPS could still be seen even with the management interface down on the target node.
4) The management interface was turned up after around 7-8 minutes. The node status went back to good and the cluster status went back to being healthy. All the volumes got re-attached to their respective pods.

Test Description: Node management interface down and up after volume moves to Down state.  Pods are still running.
Expected Behaviour: Volumes must should move to Busy state and IOs should continue

Test Description: With Replication Controller and management interface goes down
Expected Behaviour: Volume remains in Down (phase : Available) IOs should continue
Notes / Detailed Description: When the management interface was turned down on the target node, the volume became Down(Degraded), RCs remained in Running state. Cluster status changed to NoFaultTolerance and the node got into Failed state. The volumes got reattached after the mgmt interface was turned up again.

Expected Behaviour: Pod remans in CreashLoppBack state, volume remains in Busy state.
Notes / Detailed Description:
1) All the pods went into CrashLoopbackOff state
2)Volumes stayed into Down(Degraded) state
3) Node was in failed state and the cluster went into NoFaultTolerance state.
4) Even after the node came up and the cluster got back to Healthy, the pods still stayed in CrashLoopbackOff state.
5) The volumes went back to attached state.

Test Description: etcd master's managment interface not reachable
Expected Behaviour: According to its position in cluster ( whether it is initiator or target)
Notes / Detailed Description:
Made etcd master(appserv91) as the target node and turned down the management interface on it for about 7-8 minutes. Appserv90 was the initiator. 
1) Etcd master changed from appserv91 to appserv92.
2) All the volumes went into Down(degraded state).
3) When the management interface was turned up,  all the pods and volumes got reattached and the cluster status got back to normal
4) Default route had to be added back to appserv91 after the management interface was turned up.

Test Description: cluster master's managment interface not reachable
Expected Behaviour: According to its position in cluster ( whether it is initiator or target)
Notes / Detailed Description:
Created all the volumes on cluster master node appserv90 to make it the target node. The pods were scheduled on appserv91. Turned the management interface down on appserv90 (master node)
1) appserv90 went into Failed state and the Master migrated to appserv92.
2) All the volumes went into Down(Degraded) state
3) The management interface was shut for almost 7-8 minutes , the pods were in Running state.
4) After the management interface was turned up, the volumes went back to Attached state and the cluster status went back to being healthy from NoFault Tolerance state.
4) Default route had to be added back to appserv91 after the management interface was turned up.
5) Default route had to be added back to appserv90 after the management interface was turned up.

Test Description: Master change after management inface down of current master node
Notes / Detailed Description: This was covered in the above TC.
